result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Otto, Joshua M

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joshua M Otto appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court for Joshua M Otto.  Prosecuting attorney M Samir Siddique in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Pursuant to negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders case dismissed but read-in to 22CM1469 for sentencing purposes.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court.  Defendant Joshua M Otto in custody.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference. Defense is in receipt of discovery and offer. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.
Case adjourned.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Walmart

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Joshua M Otto in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Defendant Joshua M Otto in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joshua M Otto appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant has lower number case(s) pending.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/76b667a0-98a1-69d4-e783-9185dc35fcc1  Status conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
